summary: cytoplasmic nonmembranous structures known as stress granules (SGs) are sites of non-translating messenger ribounucleoproteins (mRNPs) aggregation under stress conditions. SGs are involved in various stress-induced signaling cascades such as inflammatory signaling and stress-induced apoptotic signaling. eIF2 phosphorylation by one of the selective stress-activated kinases inhibits translation initiation by reducing the availability of eIF2-GTP-tRNAiMet ternary complex. other studies showed phospho-eIF2 independent mechanisms that induce translation inhibition and SG formation. high levels of ROS subject the cells to oxidative stress, which forces the cell to possese certain abilities to combat stress conditions. stress-signaling pathways were found to play a role in ESC differentiation process [33] also found to be an important regulator of human (h)ESC pluripotency. LIN28A and L1TD1 are SG markers and identified DPPA5 as a weakly recruited SG component. granules formed in stressed hiPSCs are typical SGs. cell colonies were grown in mTeSR media (STEMCELL technologies) mouse monoclonal antibodies to eIF3n and TIAR were purchased from Santa Cruz. mouse monoclonal antibodies to eIF3n and TIAR were purchased from BD Biosciences. cells were washed thrice with PBS, fixed in 4% para-formaldehyde for 15–30 minutes at room temp (RT), then washed three times with TBST (TBS with 0.2% Tween) cells were then incubated with continuous shaking overnight at 4°C with the desired primary antibodies, diluted in the blocking buffer. cells were washed three times with PBS, dissociated using ReLeSR. cDNA was synthesized using the Superscript III first-strand cDNA synthesis kit (Invitrogen), then extracted from treated or non-treated cells. ATTTC3’ R5’GCAGTGTGTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCTCT3’ hSOX2 F5’GGGAAATGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG human umbilical Vein Endothelial Cells (HUVEC) were grown and maintained in a humidified atmosphere with 5% CO2 at 37°C. antibodies Mouse monoclonal antibodies to p70 S6 kinase (H-9) (SK1-hedles), PABP (10E10), eIF4A (N-19), rabbit polyclonal antibodies to eIF4G-(H-300), eIF4E (FL-217) tted onto nitrocellulose membranes, blocked with 5% (w/v) non-fat dry milk or bovine serum albumin in Tris-buffered saline (TBS) containing 0.1% (v/v) Tween 20. the next day, after incubation with HRP-linked secondary antibodies (1:2500) for 1h at room temperature on a rocking platform, the proteins were detected using enhanced chemiluminescence reagent (Sigma-A p70 S6 kinase, PABP, eIF4A, eIF4G-(H-300), eIF4E, eIF3n, TIAR, and G3BP were all diluted 1:200; DPPA5, LIN28A and L1TD1 were diluted 1:100. cells were washed 3 times with TBST, stained with appropriate secondary antibodies (1:2000 dilution) for 1h rocking at RT, cDNA was synthesized using the Superscript III first-strand cDNA synthesis kit (Invitrogen) according to the manufacturer's protocol. cDNA was synthesized using the Superscript III first-strand cDNA synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and then used as a template for PCR reaction to qualitatively examine gene expression of pluripotency genes. hiPSCs (IMR90-1) were treated with different concentrations of SA or H2O2. each treatment was incubated for 1h, then cells were fixed, stained with the robust SG marker (G3BP), and quantified for SG formation using fluorescence microscopy. only SA and HS induce the formation of SGs compared to non-treated cells that showed no granules. SG assembly in human induced pluripotent stem cells is stress specific. cells treated with 125M sodium arsenite and H2O2 (250M and 2mM) or subjected to heat shock (42°C) stained with robust SG marker. stress granules formed in human induced pluripotent stem cells are canonical stress granules. phosphorylation of eIF2 (peIF2) is dependent on eIF2 phosphorylation. induction of granules is peIF2-independent in cells treated with H2O2. eIF2 phosphorylation and SG formation in hiPSCs. eIF2 formation differs depending on cell and nature of stress. eIF2 formation differs depending on cell and nature of stress. known SG markers, TIAR, eIF4E, eIF4A; eIF3B, eIF4G, and PABP. in non-treated cells or cells incubated at 37°C, all SG protein markers were normally distributed within the cytoplasm or the nucleus. in hiPSCs treated with SA or subjected to HS, these markers were recruited to SGs (Fig 2C and 2D; white arrows) granules formed in stressed hiPSCs are typical SGs in terms of size, number, and types of protein recruited, despite differences in the characteristics of the granules induced by HS treatment. cells treated with sodium arsenite or (B) heat shock (42°C) followed by emetine treatment (42 oC+Em) or recovered from HS (42 oC+Rec) and stained with SG marker eIF3b (red total RNA was extracted from non-treated cells or cells subjected to stressors. a qualitative RNA analysis of six endogenous pluripotent protein markers was performed using RT-PCR. the expression levels of each protein were quantified using a densitometer and normalized to levels of non-treated cells. RNA extracted from non-treated hiPSCs or cells subjected to sodium arsenite, H2O2 and heat shock to detect pluripotent genes. LIN28A and LIN28A have previously been shown to co-localize in SGs. cells were left untreated or treated with either SA or HS. stained with antibodies directed against LIN28A, L1TD1 and DPPA5 as well as the SG marker, G3BP. some aggregates co-localize with G3BP SGs (white arrows), others do not. LIN28A is highly recruited to SGs (white arrows). DPPA5 is a novel component of SGs. hiPSCs (IMR90-1) were treated with different concentrations of SA or H2O2 or subjected to HS at different temperatures. each treatment was incubated for 1h, then cells were fixed, stained with the robust SG marker (G3BP), and quantified for SG formation. a different pattern of SG formation was observed in HS treated cells. SG assembly in human induced pluripotent stem cells is stress specific. cells treated with 125M sodium arsenite and H2O2 (250M and 2mM) or subjected to heat shock (42°C) stress granules formed in human induced pluripotent stem cells are canonical stress granules. phosphorylation of eIF2 (peIF2) is dependent on eIF2 phosphorylation. induction of granules is peIF2-independent in cells treated with H2O2. eIF2 phosphorylation and SG formation in hiPSCs. eIF2 levels in non-treated cells or cells treated with 125M sodium arsenite and 250M H2O2. eIF4E, eIF4A, eIF3B, eIF4G, and PABP. all SG protein markers were normally distributed within the cytoplasm or the nucleus. in hiPSCs treated with SA or subjected to HS, these markers were recruited to SGs (Fig 2C and 2D; white arrows) granules formed in stressed hiPSCs are typical SGs in terms of size, number, and types of protein recruited, despite differences in the characteristics of the granules induced by HS treatment. cells treated with sodium arsenite or (B) heat shock (42°C) followed by emetine treatment (42 oC+Em) or recovered from HS (42 oC+Rec) and stained with SG marker eIF3b (red total RNA was extracted from non-treated cells or cells subjected to stressors. a qualitative RNA analysis of six endogenous pluripotent protein markers was performed using RT-PCR. expression levels of each protein were quantified using a densitometer and normalized to the levels of non-treated cells. treated hiPSCs or cells subjected to sodium arsenite, H2O2, and heat shock to detect pluripotent genes. GAPDH is used as a loading control. bar graphs represent the levels (normalized with -actin loading controls) of the tested proteins. CCCH zinc finger (ZF) RBD and RNA Recognition motif (RRM) domain. the K homology (KH) domain is recognized as the RBD of DPPA5. cells were left untreated or treated with either SA or HS. some of these aggregates co-localize with G3BP SGs (white arrows) whereas others do not (Fig 5A; SA and 42°C). LIN28A is highly recruited to SGs (white arrows), as shown by its strong co-localization with G3BP. assembled granules exhibit typical SGs features, including shape, size, number, composition, and disassembly process. RNA binding pluripotent markers LIN28A, L1TD1, and DPPA5 are selectively recruited to SGs in stressed hiPSCs. granules formed in response to both HS and SA treatments resemble those formed in mammalian cells [53] the formation of SGs in stressed ESCs may be one of these protective mechanisms during development. this assumption is supported by the fact that SGs are able to selectively sequester and protect mRNA from degradation, which will eventually be required for ESC development. ARE elements containing mRNAs were found to be highly recruited to SGs. TIAR binds to NANOG mRNA and/or other ARE elements of mRNAs. this could be due to the high expression of glutathione peroxidases (Gpxs) hiPSCs are stress-specific and stimulate the recruitment of selective PPMs. it is possible that SGs selectively sequester different classes of mRNAs and proteins that regulate pluripotency. thus SGs may be a switch between self-renewal and differentiation. representative fluorescence microscopy images showing hiPSCs treated with 125M SA, subjected to HS (42°C), or left untreated. insets show magnified views of SGs in individual and merged channels (yellow).
